intro: Hieracium magnolianum, commonly known as the Magnolia hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium magnolianum is often found in association with other herbaceous plants in its native environment.
